alert.note: Alert for Camden; Maries; Miller; Phelps; Pulaski (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 9:43PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT MARIES...MILLER...NORTHERN PULASKI...NORTHERN PHELPS AND CENTRAL CAMDEN COUNTIES THROUGH 1015 PM CDT... At 943 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of St. Thomas to near Crocker to near Camdenton. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Rolla, Lake of The Ozarks State Park, Lake of The Ozarks, Ha Ha Tonka State Park, Eldon, Osage Beach, St. James, Camdenton, Village of Four Seasons, Lake Ozark, Dixon, Belle, Crocker, Iberia, Doolittle, Vienna, Newburg, Sunrise Beach, St. Elizabeth and Saint Elizabeth. This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 172 and 179, and between mile markers 184 and 200. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for central and east central Missouri.
